title: How to Make Thai Yellow Curry

steps.headline: Soak galanga and kaffir lime rind for 1 to 2 hours in hot water.
Scrape out the pulp of the kaffir lime rind and slice thinly.
Reserve 1 tbsp.
steps.description: (15 ml) of the galanga and 1 tsp. (4.9 ml) of the kaffir lime rind. Make sure both are firmly packed.

steps.headline: Soak the peppers in hot water for 15 minutes until soft.
Dry-roast the black peppercorns, coriander seeds, and cumin seeds on medium-high heat for 4 to 5 minutes.
steps.description: Flip them frequently to prevent burning.

steps.headline: Grind the contents with a mortar.
steps.description: Grind until you produce a fine powder. Add water to blend the ingredients into a paste. This will produce about 1 1/4 cups (296 ml) of curry paste. You can also use a pre-made yellow curry paste.

steps.headline: Cut up chicken and potatoes into bite-sized pieces.
steps.description: These pieces can range from 1 to 2 inches (2.54 to 5.08 cm) depending on how big you like it. The amount of chicken used varies based on how much you plan on serving. Typical amounts of chicken range from 1 to 3 lb. (0.5 to 1.35 kg), while amounts of potatoes range from 1/2 to 2 lb. (0.2 to 0.9 kg). Some recipes call for you to boil the potatoes separately beforehand.

steps.headline: Turn a stove burner to a low or medium heat.
steps.description: The level of heat you use depends on the amount of yellow curry you are cooking. The more curry prepared, the higher the heat should be.

steps.headline: Pour coconut milk into a large pot and place it on the burner.
steps.description: Do not pour the entire amount of milk in at once. Instead, pour in little amounts gradually throughout the cooking process. The amount of coconut milk used can range from 1/2 to 3 cups (120 to 700 ml).

steps.headline: Heat the coconut milk until it boils.
Put in yellow curry paste.
steps.description: Stir it thoroughly into the milk. The amount of curry paste used can range from 1 to 3 tbsp. (15 to 45 ml).

steps.headline: Put in fish sauce and the chicken.
steps.description: Stir until all the chicken pieces are completely covered in the sauce. The amount of fish sauce can range from 2 to 4 tbsp. (30 to 60 ml).

steps.headline: Cook the chicken until it is halfway done.
steps.description: Chicken is typically halfway done when it just begins to brown.

steps.headline: Add in more coconut milk and the potatoes.
steps.description: Cover the potatoes in the sauce.

steps.headline: Bring the sauce to a boil, then cover the pot.
steps.description: Let the ingredients cook until thoroughly done. As it cooks, you can add small amounts of water if the curry looks too dry. This recipe serves 2 to 4.

text: Making Thai Yellow Curry Paste Soak galanga and kaffir lime rind for 1 to 2 hours in hot water.  Scrape out the pulp of the kaffir lime rind and slice thinly.  Reserve 1 tbsp. (15 ml) of the galanga and 1 tsp. (4.9 ml) of the kaffir lime rind. Make sure both are firmly packed. Soak the peppers in hot water for 15 minutes until soft. Remove the seeds afterward. Dry-roast the black peppercorns, coriander seeds, and cumin seeds on medium-high heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Flip them frequently to prevent burning. Grind the contents with a mortar. Grind until you produce a fine powder. Add water to blend the ingredients into a paste. This will produce about 1 1/4 cups (296 ml) of curry paste. You can also use a pre-made yellow curry paste. Making Thai Yellow Curry Chicken Cut up chicken and potatoes into bite-sized pieces. These pieces can range from 1 to 2 inches (2.54 to 5.08 cm) depending on how big you like it. The amount of chicken used varies based on how much you plan on serving. Typical amounts of chicken range from 1 to 3 lb. (0.5 to 1.35 kg), while amounts of potatoes range from 1/2 to 2 lb. (0.2 to 0.9 kg). Some recipes call for you to boil the potatoes separately beforehand. Turn a stove burner to a low or medium heat. The level of heat you use depends on the amount of yellow curry you are cooking. The more curry prepared, the higher the heat should be. Pour coconut milk into a large pot and place it on the burner. Do not pour the entire amount of milk in at once. Instead, pour in little amounts gradually throughout the cooking process. The amount of coconut milk used can range from 1/2 to 3 cups (120 to 700 ml). Heat the coconut milk until it boils. Stir it consistently. Put in yellow curry paste. Stir it thoroughly into the milk. The amount of curry paste used can range from 1 to 3 tbsp. (15 to 45 ml). Put in fish sauce and the chicken. Stir until all the chicken pieces are completely covered in the sauce. The amount of fish sauce can range from 2 to 4 tbsp. (30 to 60 ml). Cook the chicken until it is halfway done. Chicken is typically halfway done when it just begins to brown. Add in more coconut milk and the potatoes. Cover the potatoes in the sauce. Bring the sauce to a boil, then cover the pot. Let the ingredients cook until thoroughly done. As it cooks, you can add small amounts of water if the curry looks too dry. This recipe serves 2 to 4. Finished.
